Articles.Content:
Behold! My stock Hawker Hunter! It's a work in progress, so it's in early days.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

The Hawker Hunter is a subsonic British jet aircraft developed in the 1950s. The single-seat Hunter entered service as a manoeuvrable fighter aircraft, and later operated in fighter-bomber and reconnaissance roles in numerous conflicts. The Hunter was also widely exported, serving with 21 other air forces; 50 years after its original introduction it is still in active service, operating with the Lebanese Air Force.

On 7 September 1953, the modified first prototype broke the world air speed record, achieving 727.63 mph (1,171.01 km/h). Hunters were also used by two RAF display teams; the "Black Arrows", who on one occasion looped a record-breaking 22 examples in formation, and later the "Blue Diamonds", who flew 16 aircraft. Overall, 1,972 Hunters were produced by Hawker Siddeley and under licence. In British service, the aircraft was replaced by the English Electric Lightning, the Hawker Siddeley Harrier and the McDonnell Douglas Phantom.

Once complete I plan to provide a download pack including the following versions;

-[STOCK (COMPLETE) and FAR versions;]-

---Without drop tanks

---With two drop tanks

---With four drop tanks

---Various BahamutoD's Armoury variants including rocket pods, sidewinders, bombs and Mavericks.

Enough of the chatter... photos! Please bare in mind this is a work in progress, so my Hunter may look a little off. I'm happy with both appraisal and criticism to improve the aircraft before download is released to all

Download Added
That's quite an impressive replica. I like the attention to detail

That's quite an impressive replica. I like the attention to detail

Thank you
Oh yes, nice replica of that plane.
That is EPIC!!!

Thanks guys for the positive comments and reps!

I now have 3 save files for this aircraft;

-Hawker Hunter

-Hawker Hunter w/ 2 drop-tanks

-Hawker Hunter w/ 4 drop-tanks

These three saves are 100% stock

I've worked out a lot of statistics for the aircraft;

Hawker Hunter

Fuel: 300L Standard.

Endurance/range;

@ 0m (0ft)Sea level: 57m50s (3,470s) / 710KM

@ 3048m (10,000ft): 1h,1m,40s (3,700s) / 980KM

@ 6096m (20,000ft): 1h,1m,34s (3,694s) / 1,250KM

@ 9144m (30,000ft): 58m49s (3,529s) / 1,500KM

@ 12,192m (40,000ft) : 1h,2m (3,720s) / 1,900KM

@ 15,240m (15,000ft) : 1h,10m (4,200s) / 2,500KM

Hawker Hunter with 2 drop tanks increases endurance by 24% and range by 19.7% to 850KM @ ASL and 3,010KM @ 15,240m/50,000ft

Hawker Hunter with 4 drop tanks increases endurance by a further 11% and range by a further 8.2% to 920KM @ ASL and 3,270KM @ 15,240m/50,000ft

Here are the three configurations parked together:
Demo video
As my Hunter is nearing completion, I've added a poll for my next replica.
Ah, the hunter. I had a nice Supermarine Swift - its contemporary - back in .24.2 but that went with the new save :/

Ah yeah the Swift! Also a nice place, but ran into technical problems so the Hunter was preferred and came out on top.
